frame.name: Commerce_collect
frame.definition:
<def-root>Subframe of Commerce_money-transfer in which the Seller comes to have the Money. <ex></ex> <asf>ASFALDA French FrameNet comment</asf>: Added FR_Getting_money as a super-frame of this frame, for the LUs which do not necessarily imply a commercial transaction.
</def-root>

FE.name: Buyer
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Buyer</fen> wants the <fen>Goods</fen> and offers <fen>Money</fen> to a <fen>Seller</fen> in exchange for them. <ex><fex name="Byr">Lee</fex> was <t>charged</t> $100 for dry-cleaning</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Goods
FE.definition: <def-root>The FE Goods is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for Money in a transaction. <ex>Lee was <t>charged</t> $100 <fex name="Gds">for dry-cleaning</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Money
FE.definition: <def-root>Money is the thing given in exchange for Goods in a transaction. <ex>Lee was <t>billed</t> <fex name="Mny">$100</fex> for dry-cleaning</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Rate
FE.definition: <def-root>In isome cases, price or payment is described per unit of Goods. <ex>The cleaner <t>charges</t> <fex name="Rate">forty dollers per hour</fex> for his services.</ex> <ex>The cleaner <t>charged</t> us <fex name="Rate">at forty dollars per hour</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Unit
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is any unit in which goods or services can be measured. Generally, it occurs in a <ment>by</ment>-PP. <ex>I <t>bill</t> for etiquette lessons <fex name="Unit">by the hour</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Seller
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Seller</fen> has possession of the <fen>Goods</fen> and exchanges them for <fen>Money</fen> from a <fen>Buyer</fen>. <ex><fex name="Slr">The Hotel Carlyle in New York</fex> is rumored to <t>charge</t> $80,000 a night for some of its rooms.</ex></def-root>
